item.title: Reading a String instead of an Int from Config.java [PI]
item.dc:creator: @projeccct projeccct
item.description:
@projeccct wrote:

[quote=“AtomicInt_, post:7, topic:417391”]Like

String item[] = { “godsword” };

Would make all items with the ‘godsword’ prefix in the name not spawn-able?[/quote]

Yes, I have that part in pvpconfig configured already, now I just need to find out how to make it work in an item command. Because right now the command is reading the ID’s

item.title: Reading a String instead of an Int from Config.java [PI]
item.dc:creator: @projeccct projeccct
item.description:
@projeccct wrote:

I have my config.java configured, I need to incorporate it into the “item” command, I don’t want it to read the ints, I want it to read through strings. So if something contains whatever it will not allow you to spawn that item, since it also makes it a lot easier. Thank you for your replies though.

item.title: Reading a String instead of an Int from Config.java [PI]
item.dc:creator: @projeccct projeccct
item.description:
@projeccct wrote:

Hey guys, I am currently having a problem converting this command from reading an Int array to a String array of items that you cannot spawn.

Currently I have this.

if (playerCommand.startsWith("item")) { try { String[] args = playerCommand.split(" "); if (args.length == 3) { int newItemID = Integer.parseInt(args[1]); int newItemAmount = Integer.parseInt(args[2]); for (int i : PvPConfig.COMBAT_ITEM1) { if(i == newItemID) { c.sendMessage("This item is a PvP item and cannot be spawned."); return; } }

COMBAT_ITEM1 being my unspawnable String array list at the moment, but right now this code is meant for Ints only not Strings. Does anyone have a simple way to possibly convert this?

Thank you for any feedback if you help out.

Read full topic
item.source: Reading a String instead of an Int from Config.java [PI]
